p: The still significantly reduced number of gene copies of AOB at the end of the growing season in September in conjunction with the positive correlation of the abundance of AOB in soil and nitrification ( Fig 7) suggest that the climate-change triggered mechanism of impaired nitrification activity with associated consequences for NO 3 - availability and uptake by beech seedlings is persistent. This was also confirmed by the smaller long-term 15N recovery in beech seedlings in all labelling treatments ( Fig 8) and the reduced N metabolite levels in the beech seedlings ( Fig 9).
